metadata.title: CVE-2021-3156 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Sudo before 1.9.5p2 contains an off-by-one error that can result in aheap-based buffer overflow, which allows privilege escalation to root via"sudoedit -s" and a command-line argument that ends with a single backslashcharacter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.8.16-0ubuntu1.10
sudo-ldap - 1.8.16-0ubuntu1.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sudo package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.16-0ubuntu1.10').
